content:
Devi andare nelle impostazioni dell'account (menu > impostazioni account) Poi alla voce Impostazioni server Qui trova la riga Metodo di autenticazione ed impostala ad Oauth2

Sempre in Impostazioni account, vai quindi in Server in uscita (SMTP), e fai la stessa modifica per il server hotmail.

Riavvia Thunderbird e, quando richiesto fai login nel tuo account Hotmail.

content:
Hi Doug, You could find more info about the Junk settings and how you can train Thunderbird to recognize junk messages here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages

You also need to right click on your account - Settings - Junk Settings - Move new junk messages to: (and select your junk folder)

There is a high probability that your e-mail provider already classified them as spam, so you could enable also the setting - Trust Junk mail headers set by: and then select your providers' classifier.

This might take time, please be patient!

If you want an immediate effect, you can set up a filter like the one on the screenshot. You can start by clicking the Tools> Message Filters from your main menu. Please note the "Clasification" dropdown.

creator: davidsk

content:
• crea un collegamento a Thunderbird sul Desktop
  • apri la finestra Esegui di Windows con la combinazione di tasti Win+R (permi cioè il tasto Windows sulla tastiera e contemporaneamente il tasto R)
  • digita in Esegui il comando shell:sendto e premi invio
  • si aprirà la cartella SendTo
  • Sposta il collegamento a Thunderbird dal Desktop a SendTo

Adesso dovresti trovare un rimando a Thunderbird nel sotto menu Invia a. Questo collegamento è indipendente dal Destinatario posta che invece è gestito da Windows e dipende dalle impostazioni dei programmi predefiniti.

content: The purest way, assuming Windows, is to use windows file explorer, locate c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming and delete the folder named Thunderbird. Do this after uninstalling thunderbird and it will reinstall clean.

content:
I think I finally found the issue, the folderCache.json file. The file contained the entire structure or folders of the IMAP account, (e.g. Inbox, Trash, Junk folders. etc.) I deleted those lines in the file. The IMAP account no longer appears when I launch TB. I created the POP3 account. So far so good. Sent several test emails successfully. Launched and shutdown TB, so far no issues. Looking like the file was the problem.

Thank!!!!
